tweets.text:
At Health Questions I asked @MattHancock about the public health implications of the breaches at Walley's Quarry.

I know, from both the local GPs and those writing to me, that many residents are concerned for their health, both physically and mentally. @PHE_uk @EnvAgencyMids https://t.co/pwh6zUI4Zs

domain.name: Interests and Hobbies
domain.description: Interests, opinions, and behaviors of individuals, groups, or cultures; like Speciality Cooking or Theme Parks

tweets.text: Anyone know why builders at Mitcham Bridge are dumping waste into the River Wandle? I recorded this today at 3:15. #wandle @EnvAgencySE  @EnvAgency @riverlevel_2135 @Merton_Council https://t.co/czmoLpKGHd

@MrNickKnowles @EnvAgencyMids 

I know you have likely had your fill of the landfill.  But a retweet of this post would be amazing if your would oblige.  

https://t.co/71Mvaa12bz

The pollution we are putting up with is wrong on any level.  A mile away and it stinks.

tweets.text: My brother recently asked for freedom of information regarding sewage dumped in the Sussex Rother (which killed fish populations). It‚Äôs all legal. We know this is happening, but nothing is done. It affects us all, nature-lovers or not. https://t.co/oMWWxNrJPZ https://t.co/MSpj76pUCF

@killicktom @EnvAgency @pippamaslin @MarkGale @harryhpalmer @MitchamCrktGrn @MitchamSociety @Merton_Council @MartinWhelton We have written to @Merton_Council asking for details of what is happening at Mitcham Bridge which is causing the pollution and what action is being taken by the contractors @LandandWaterCo

@WandleForum @killicktom @EnvAgency @pippamaslin @harryhpalmer @MitchamCrktGrn @MitchamSociety @Merton_Council @MartinWhelton @LandandWaterCo The Environment Agency visited on Friday after my clip I filmed the day before and reported. 
https://t.co/yB8JDkYWbS

@MarkGale @killicktom @EnvAgency @pippamaslin @harryhpalmer @MitchamCrktGrn @MitchamSociety @Merton_Council @MartinWhelton @LandandWaterCo The challenge for @EnvAgencySE with reports of Wandle pollution over last year  has been getting on site in time to get a water sample - hopefully successful this time and why it is so important to report incidents on 0800 807060 as soon as possible https://t.co/fHI6VxMOJg

@killicktom @MertonMatters @EnvAgency @pippamaslin @MarkGale @harryhpalmer @MitchamCrktGrn @MitchamSociety @Merton_Council @MartinWhelton Yes come on @MartinWhelton you profess to be so concerned about local pollution

Thank you for raising this Aaron. Both @PHE_uk and @EnvAgencyMids need to have more urgency in their effort and actions to stop the stink and to reassure local people re health  implications. https://t.co/T2B2okOHA8
